content:
• Tuesday, October 11, 2011
  • TEL

    TE Connectivity (NYSE:TEL) will replace Cephalon (NASDAQ:CEPH) in the S&P 500 index after...

    TE Connectivity (NYSE:TEL) will replace Cephalon (NASDAQ:CEPH) in the S&P 500 index after the close of trading on Friday, October 14. Cephalon is being acquired by Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (NYSE:TEVA) in a deal expected to be completed on or about that date pending final approvals. TEL +6.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM
  • NSR

    Neustar (NYSE:NSR), a provider of call-routing services, gains 3.5% AH after reporting Q3...

    Neustar (NYSE:NSR), a provider of call-routing services, gains 3.5% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $152.5M (+18% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.51, beating consensus by $3.5M and $0.07. The company now expects FY11 EPS of $1.76-$1.84, above a consensus of $1.74. Neustar is also announcing it will acquire TARGUSinfo, a provider of caller ID services, for $650M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • EXFO

    EXFO, a maker of network testing gear, falls 4.2% AH after reporting FQ4 revenue of $64.4M (+10%...

    EXFO, a maker of network testing gear, falls 4.2% AH after reporting FQ4 revenue of $64.4M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.03, missing consensus by $0.3M and $0.04. Gross margin declined by 0.6 points Q/Q, to 63.6%, and the company reported a book-to-bill ratio of 0.97. EXFO shares plunged in June following an EPS miss.Â  (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) drops 4.7% AH following its Q3 EPS miss. Other aluminum stocks are also trading...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) drops 4.7% AH following its Q3 EPS miss. Other aluminum stocks are also trading lower on the news. CENX -4%. NOR -1%. ACH -2.3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • CDXS

    Shares of Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) tack on a 3.4% gain AH after the firm announces it entered a...

    Shares of Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) tack on a 3.4% gain AH after the firm announces it entered a joint development agreement with a Brazil-based biofuels JV that includes Shell (NYSE:RDS.A).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • AUTH

    AuthenTec (NASDAQ:AUTH) finishes the day with a +14.1% gain after it says LG Electronics...

    AuthenTec (NASDAQ:AUTH) finishes the day with a +14.1% gain after it says LG Electronics (OTC:LGEAF) has chosen its QuickSec VPN security for use in its Android smartphones.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • IDCC

    M&A rumors continue giving InterDigital (IDCC +6.6%) investors vertigo. Shares rose today on...

    M&A rumors continue giving InterDigital (IDCC +6.6%) investors vertigo. Shares rose today on a DealReporter story claiming bidders who had given up on buying the company may be reconsidering, and Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) could be trying to form a consortium that would make a bid. 2 weeks ago, a DealReporter story sent InterDigital shares in the opposite direction.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • LM

    Sterne Agee cuts 2012 profit estimates and ratings for some publicly traded asset managers due...

    Sterne Agee cuts 2012 profit estimates and ratings for some publicly traded asset managers due to market weakness and a much more challenging net flow environment in August than previously anticipated: Legg Mason (LM -0.7%) and Federated Investors (FII -2.26%) are both reduced to underperform (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • S

    Though still well below its price prior to Friday's investor day fiasco, Sprint (S +7.7%) is...

    Though still well below its price prior to Friday's investor day fiasco, Sprint (S +7.7%) is rebounding, as a positive report from FBR outweighs negative ones from Credit Suisse, Argus, and Morgan Stanley. Peter Rysavy argues Sprint "had no choice" but to push forward with a costly LTE 4G rollout, given how carriers around the world have standardized on LTE.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • SLB

    "There are no signs of a slowdown, not yet" in the oil and gas industry due to the weak global...

    "There are no signs of a slowdown, not yet" in the oil and gas industry due to the weak global economy, Schlumberger (SLB +2.2%) chairman Andrew Gould says. Oilfield services companies - SLB is the world's largest - are considered a barometer of the overall industry's health given that their businesses tend to increase when producers raise their investment spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • USAK

    USA Truck (USAK +20.5%) responds to Celadon's (CGI +4.8%) SEC filing in connection to an...

    USA Truck (USAK +20.5%) responds to Celadon's (CGI +4.8%) SEC filing in connection to an acquisition bid for the truckload carrier: "Our board of directors will evaluate Celadon's 13D filing in due course." Possible translation: With our stock down 25% YTD, we are thrilled with the offer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • LH

    Laboratory Corp. of America (LH -1.8%) dips after RBC cut the stock to sector perform, citing...

    Laboratory Corp. of America (LH -1.8%) dips after RBC cut the stock to sector perform, citing ongoing weakness in its physician office visits, plus ongoing regulatory and reimbursement concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MX

    MagnaChip Semiconductor (MX +6.8%) gains after announcing a $35M stock buyback, as the company...

    MagnaChip Semiconductor (MX +6.8%) gains after announcing a $35M stock buyback, as the company takes advantage of a drop in share price - nearly 60% since April - to repurchase shares at a deep-discount.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • CGI

    Trucker Celadon Group (CGI +4.8%) reports a 6.29% stake in USA Truck (USAK +20.2%), and says...

    Trucker Celadon Group (CGI +4.8%) reports a 6.29% stake in USA Truck (USAK +20.2%), and says it's interested in buying its smaller rival. In an SEC filing, Celadon said it recently asked to meet USAK management to discuss a possible association between the companies, potentially including a combination of the two.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • MTL

    Russian mining and steel group Mechel's (MTL -4.9%) H1 profits rose four-fold Y/Y to $501M due...

    Russian mining and steel group Mechel's (MTL -4.9%) H1 profits rose four-fold Y/Y to $501M due to an increase in coal mining volume and reduced asset costs, but the stock is trading lower after the company made cautious comments on its current Q2. It says the situation in the steel market is getting increasingly difficult, as cost increases in raw materials aren't being compensated by rising steel prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • VLO

    Valero (VLO +3%) adds to yesterday's gains thanks to an upgrade to Outperform from Barclays'...

    Valero (VLO +3%) adds to yesterday's gains thanks to an upgrade to Outperform from Barclays' Paul Cheng. Cheng sees "limited downside risk" to Valero at current prices, and notes the company, which has underperformed fellow refiners this year, sports a lower valuation than it did during 2 of the last 3 industry down cycles.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR +2.1%) outperforms after Barclays reiterates an Overweight on the networking gear...

    Juniper (JNPR +2.1%) outperforms after Barclays reiterates an Overweight on the networking gear provider, with a PT of $30. Barclays believes concerns about weak sales and product delays are already baked into shares, and that checks reveal "generally stable" pricing. Juniper was crushed in July following a weak Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -3.5%) is down after Piper Jaffray cut the shares to neutral from...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -3.5%) is down after Piper Jaffray cut the shares to neutral from overweight, saying channel checks point to a slowdown in MOCVD orders and an increasingly difficult credit environment in China.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • GPI

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI +2.8%) trades higher after ThinkEquity ups the shares to buy from hold....

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI +2.8%) trades higher after ThinkEquity ups the shares to buy from hold. The firm says Group 1's heavy dealership exposure to leading Japanese brands, most notably Toyota (TM -0.8%), will benefit from a pickup in new car sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU +6.1%) adds to its gains after reporting its September traffic increased 7.6% Y/Y,...

    JetBlue (JBLU +6.1%) adds to its gains after reporting its September traffic increased 7.6% Y/Y, to 2.37B revenue passenger miles. The low-cost airline's load factor declined 0.8 points Y/Y, to 79.8%

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (JVA +26%) racks up another double-digit gain today as Roth starts coverage on...

    Coffee Holding (JVA +26%) racks up another double-digit gain today as Roth starts coverage on the company with a buy and a $15 price target. Roth says revenue growth has been rapid, partly due to the popularity of Green Mountain's (GMCR +1.3%) K-cup system, new green coffee customers and recent joint ventures.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (SYNA +4.8%) shares are on the move after Collins Stewart raises its rating on the...

    Synaptics (SYNA +4.8%) shares are on the move after Collins Stewart raises its rating on the maker of touch pads for smartphones and PCs to Buy, reflecting higher smartphone demand in China and market share gains at HTC. But estimates are trimmed for other players, as smartphone growth is not seen offseting broader economic headwinds. CY -0.2%, ATML +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (ARO +5.4%) gives an added boost to an earlier upgrade by Jefferies this morning,...

    Aeropostale (ARO +5.4%) gives an added boost to an earlier upgrade by Jefferies this morning, when it says its children's stores will start offering an exclusive collection of Marvel superheroes merchandise later this month. The company expects the well-known super-hero characters to give a solid bump-up to store sales over the holiday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • AAL

    American Airlines' (NASDAQ:AMR) decision to pare back capacity helps lift shares 8.2% higher, as...

    American Airlines' (NASDAQ:AMR) decision to pare back capacity helps lift shares 8.2% higher, as talk about a bankruptcy fades further into the background. The next issue for AMR: Tackling labor costs. Though the accepted common wisdom says the carrier faces a disadvantage over rivals stemming from a history of never filing for bankruptcy, union leaders contend it isn't true and look set to battle the company for every dollar.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOV

    National Oilwell Varco (NOV +2.5%) gains after Moody's ups its outlook on the company to...

    National Oilwell Varco (NOV +2.5%) gains after Moody's ups its outlook on the company to positive on strong rig equipment-order growth and expectations that higher cyclical earnings and margins will continue into next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • BEN

    Franklin Resources (BEN -2.7%) trades lower after reporting its month-end AUM declined nearly 8%...

    Franklin Resources (BEN -2.7%) trades lower after reporting its month-end AUM declined nearly 8% M/M. The company suffered over $9B of net outflows in September, up from $1B in August. Underperformance from the company's global and international strategies caused the worst hit due to bad currency bets, particularly in its flagship Templeton Global Bond Fund.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft (BSFT +5.3%) pops after acquiring Finland's Movial Applications, a developer of "user...

    BroadSoft (BSFT +5.3%) pops after acquiring Finland's Movial Applications, a developer of "user interfaces and multimedia sharing applications" for a variety of communications devices. Movial's products will complement BroadSoft's infrastructure software solutions for Internet-based voice, video, and messaging.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL -2.6%) trades lower after Macquarie reduces its rating on the stock to...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL -2.6%) trades lower after Macquarie reduces its rating on the stock to Neutral, citing uncertainty regarding well results in its Lewis & Clark stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • LUV

    Shares of Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) poke out a 2% gain, showing no ill effects from concerns...

    Shares of Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) poke out a 2% gain, showing no ill effects from concerns voiced by Deutsche Bank analyst Michael Linenberg that the carrier will face difficulty integrating its Airtran acquisition into routes next year. The airline for its part looks to be doing more slashing and less "integrating," as it focuses on higher-margin routes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • PDLI

    PDL BioPharma (PDLI -4%) trades lower on an RBC downgrade to Sector Perform on valuation....

    PDL BioPharma (PDLI -4%) trades lower on an RBC downgrade to Sector Perform on valuation. Analyst Jason Kantor says the stock appears to have "topped out," adding the company is having trouble finding new sources of revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • UFS

    Domtar (UFS -3.5%) takes a hit after Deutsche cuts the shares to hold and slashes its price...

    Domtar (UFS -3.5%) takes a hit after Deutsche cuts the shares to hold and slashes its price target to $80 from $115. Deutsche says it sees evidence of slowing global pulp demand and increasing price pressure, particularly in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM

  • Grain prices erupt to the upside ahead of tomorrow's USDA release on supplies. Any tasty...

    Grain prices erupt to the upside ahead of tomorrow's USDA release on supplies. Any tasty information for the rest of us, Mortimer? CORN +4%, JJG +4.4%, SOYB +3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • MOS

    Fertilizer stocks are posting solid gains, helped along with takeover chatter and Credit Suisse...

    Fertilizer stocks are posting solid gains, helped along with takeover chatter and Credit Suisse calling the sector "highly compelling" on valuation. Analysts with the firm raised their aggregate earnings estimates on the group for the next three years. Advancers: MOS +5%, CF +4.4%, POT +2.8%, IPI +3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • WLTW

    Willis Group (WSH -2.7%) is lower today on a Sterne Agee downgrade to underperform . The firm...

    Willis Group (WSH -2.7%) is lower today on a Sterne Agee downgrade to underperform . The firm says the stock is likely to disappoint due to a lower balance sheet flexiblity than its peers, an excessively high multiple and overreaching consensus forecasts for FY12-13.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • KTOS

    Shares of Kratos Defense and Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) rack up a 7.8% gain after the firm...

    Shares of Kratos Defense and Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) rack up a 7.8% gain after the firm announces it landed a $8M contract from the U.S. Army to provide specialized refrigeration containers for field use.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -5.3%) is selling off for the second straight day - shares are now down over 9%...

    Netflix (NFLX -5.3%) is selling off for the second straight day - shares are now down over 9% since the company announced it would nix Qwikster. Hudson Square Research is upgrading Netflix today, but Pacific Crest is slashing its estimates, believing the video provider is suffering from "brand damage."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP -6%) falls after Raymond James' Pavel Molchanov cuts shares to Underperform, on...

    Suntech (STP -6%) falls after Raymond James' Pavel Molchanov cuts shares to Underperform, on account of the global glut in solar module supply worsening beyond expectations. Molchanov expects Suntech to post EPS of -$0.41 in 2012, far worse than the $0.14 consensus, and is also worried about the company's high debt load. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN -4.7%) trades lower after Piper Jaffray cuts the stock neutral, saying...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN -4.7%) trades lower after Piper Jaffray cuts the stock neutral, saying falling sapphire pricing and increased competition will likely pressure margins and sales growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS +5.5%) is up sharply in early trading. StreetInsider claims the move is the result...

    Mosaic (MOS +5.5%) is up sharply in early trading. StreetInsider claims the move is the result of "chatter" about Singapore's sovereign wealth fund Temasek eying the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA +3.1%) is joining other aluminum manufacturers in trading higher going into the...

    Alcoa (AA +3.1%) is joining other aluminum manufacturers in trading higher going into the company's Q3 report. Investors will pay close heed to management's comments on European demand, which RIO says has weakened, and its outlook for aluminum prices, which fell 15.2% from July through September. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • IBM

    Shares of Kenexa (KNXA +13.5%) pop after the business solutions firm says its Q3 results may be...

    Shares of Kenexa (KNXA +13.5%) pop after the business solutions firm says its Q3 results may be at or above the high-end of its previously issued guidance. CEO Rudy Karsan points to the firm's "differentiated, end-to-end value proposition" as helping it land new customers and grab higher market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • CLMT

    Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT +1.7%) outperforms after the maker of processed oils slightly...

    Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT +1.7%) outperforms after the maker of processed oils slightly lifts its quarterly dividend to $0.50/share. The hike brings Calumet's annual yield up to 11.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • TSN

    BofA gives a boost to shares of Tyson Foods (TSN +2.2%) and Smithfield Foods (SFD +2.5%),...

    BofA gives a boost to shares of Tyson Foods (TSN +2.2%) and Smithfield Foods (SFD +2.5%), raising its rating on both companies all the way to Buy from Underperform. Analysts with the firm make a "valuation call" with both stocks trading at single-digit P/E ratios.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • HSII

    Heidrick & Struggles (NASDAQ:HSII) drops 6.2% after getting tagged with a downgrade from...

    Heidrick & Struggles (NASDAQ:HSII) drops 6.2% after getting tagged with a downgrade from SunTrust to Neutral from Buy. Staffing company peers are also selling off - sharper than broad market indexes - with 1% to 2% losses showing across the board.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • S

    After so much bad news - awful analyst meeting, analyst downgrades, credit rating warning - is...

    After so much bad news - awful analyst meeting, analyst downgrades, credit rating warning - is Sprint (S +2.7%) now a buy? FBR Capital adds the stock to its Top Picks, citing “an intact margin expansion thesis, debt capacity to fund the network upgrade, and sufficient spectrum capacity to 2014." But Credit Suisse removes the stock from its Focus List, "given heightened liquidity concerns."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • JNY

    Shares of Jones Group (NYSE:JNY) shoot up 12.2% after the apparel maker confirms it's in...

    Shares of Jones Group (NYSE:JNY) shoot up 12.2% after the apparel maker confirms it's in discussions with Israeli firm Delta Galil Industries regarding the sale of its Jones' Jeanswear division for an estimated amount of $350M - $400M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • BRK.A

    Chinese bank stocks sky after Huijin Investments - an arm of China's SWF - buys $31M worth of...

    Chinese bank stocks sky after Huijin Investments - an arm of China's SWF - buys $31M worth of shares in the 4 major lenders. Huijin is already controlling shareholder of those banks, so its move is not totally unlike Berkshire Hathaway stepping into the market to buy up stock in BRK.A.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UTHR) plans to offer $210M in notes due in 2016 and use the proceeds...

    United Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UTHR) plans to offer $210M in notes due in 2016 and use the proceeds to buy back up to $212M in stock. Shares +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • BBND

    Premarket gainers: BBND +74%. NDN +4%. HMC +3%.Losers: ING -5%. RIO -4%. NBG -4%. BHP -3%.

    Premarket gainers: BBND +74%. NDN +4%. HMC +3%.
    Losers: ING -5%. RIO -4%. NBG -4%. BHP -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • ARO

    Shares of Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) gain 4.5% premarket after catching an upgrade from Jefferies...

    Shares of Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) gain 4.5% premarket after catching an upgrade from Jefferies with a timely $20 price target. "We believe the company is currently near trough fundamentals and expect improving trends over the coming quarters."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • NDN

    99 Cents Only (NYSE:NDN) agrees to be acquired by affiliates of Ares Management and Canada...

    99 Cents Only (NYSE:NDN) agrees to be acquired by affiliates of Ares Management and Canada Pension Plan Investment Board for $22/share in cash, in a transaction with a total equity value of ~$1.6B. NDN has been the subject of M&A rumors since a going-private proposal was announced earlier this year. NDN +4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • JEC

    Technical services contractor Jacobs Engineering (NYSE:JEC) gains 3.6% premarket after...

    Technical services contractor Jacobs Engineering (NYSE:JEC) gains 3.6% premarket after announcing it received contracts from seven Alberta oil sands clients in its FQ4, which ended in September. The total estimated value of the contracts is more than $1.4B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • DTG

    Dollar Thrifty (NYSE:DTG) announces it has terminated its solicitation process and will continue...

    Dollar Thrifty (NYSE:DTG) announces it has terminated its solicitation process and will continue to execute as an independent company, quashing a $2.1B bid from Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ) that didn't win over the board. The company also reiterates its $400M stock buyback program and Q3 earnings guidance. Premarket: DTG -3.6%, HTZ +4.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM
  • ARRS

    Cable infrastructure gear vendor Arris (NASDAQ:ARRS) has agreed to acquire smaller peer BigBand...

    Cable infrastructure gear vendor Arris (NASDAQ:ARRS) has agreed to acquire smaller peer BigBand Networks (NASDAQ:BBND) for $2.24/share in cash, a 76% premium to BigBand's Monday close. BigBand was a pioneer in the development of switched digital video technology, which increases cable network capacity, but has fallen on hard times as competitors have caught up.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
